title: Memories and portraits,
author: Stevenson, Robert Louis
snippet: The fable, as set forth in the play-book, proved to be not worthy of the scenes and characters  : what fable would not ? Such passages  as : "Scene 6. The Hermitage. Night set scene.

title: A physician's vacation;
author: Channing, Walter 1786-1876. [from old catalog]
snippet: Let this only have a voice, and its word may always be heard. The Hermitage speaks. Is not Art there well nigh dumb ?

title: A physician's vacation;
author: Channing, Walter 1786-1876. [from old catalog]
snippet: The Hermitage is in immediate proximity to the Winter Palace, and whenever the Emperor is absent from St. Petersburg,  they may be seen together. His banner was " on the outer wall," yesterday, Monday, so I was limited in my explorations to the Hermitage.

title: A physician's vacation;
author: Channing, Walter 1786-1876. [from old catalog]
snippet: A dress-coat is an indispensable condition of this visit. The Hermitage is strictly a show-place. He or she who has the most plentiful  supply of curiosity is pretty sure to see the most.

title: Abroad. Journal of a tour through Great Britain and on the Continent
author: Coghill, James Henry.
snippet: Many parts of this road werecovered to the depth of hundreds of feet by the lava from thiseruption. The Hermitage, which is on a high point, was almostencircled by it. The horse-road is not well made, particulary thatpart of it between the Hermitage and the cone.
